snippet: Judge M. Teresa Sarmina said that Msgr. William J. Lynn, the highest-ranking official in the Roman Catholic Church to be convicted of covering up sexual abuse of children, should not receive special treatment.
abstract: Judge M Teresa Sarmina denies request for house arrest from Msgr William J Lynn, who will remain in jail until his sentencing; Lynn, convicted of covering up sexual abuse by priests under his supervision, faces up to seven years in prison.
lead_paragraph: Judge M. Teresa Sarmina said that Msgr. William J. Lynn, the highest-ranking official in the Roman Catholic Church to be convicted of covering up sexual abuse of children, should not receive special treatment.

headline.seo: Msgr. Lynn’s House Arrest Bid Rejected
headline.main: Priest’s Bid to Leave Jail Is Rejected
headline.print_headline: Priest’s Bid To Leave Jail Is Rejected
